Review.Titre: They banned and blocked those who…
Review.Contenu: They banned and blocked those who bought domains from third parties. I lost a beautiful domain. sav support told me to wait until the domain expires to register it again.Do you know what happened on this day? Another person bought it. My site is unknown to anyone, so there are suspicions that they took it for themselves in order to then ask for a lot of money to buy back the domain.For what reason are you blocking third parties just now? Why were they even allowed to register earlier and you didn’t notice them before?It turns out that you yourself did not keep track of them, and people who register with third parties do not know that they are violators.As a result, innocent people suffered,Give me back my favorite domain.

Review.Titre: The domain was blocked without explanation
Review.Contenu: My domain oacca.org was blocked without explanation.I didn't do anything illegal. I have asked many times to resolve my issue.I can't change NS and they don't provide a transfer code either. I can't do anything with my domain.There are no reasons for blocking.Registrar InformationName Sav.com, LLCReferral URL sav.com

Stay Away! from SAV, this is a pure scam company i lost my $8000 worth domain because of them and they don't even provide me any proof, i usually do not give negative reviews but it is my duty to inform peoples so they can not lose their precious domains.

Review.Titre: Avoid if you want support or domains released
Review.Contenu: Lots of errors on the site. Registered some domains with Sav.com (mistake). Whois will not update. Account will not let me release the domains (because the functionality is broken). Sav are themselves breaking their own terms. AND the Registrar terms. "We've escalated this to Advance Support" is a regular phrase they use.  No-one else can get in touch with Advance Support. My domains have been locked up and not released (after full payment) for nearly a month.  I need to prove I own the domains but can't. Shocking support / tech from a tech company.  I would say AVOID at all costs if you want tech support. Use them if you want to save some money but don't care about your time or experience.

horrible experience, I buy 4 .cyou domain for $0.69 each, not knowing that the renewal price is $99 each, stick to well known domain provider, don't follow my foot step of finding cheap domain, and end up losing more money, lose $400 for 4 .cyou domain, horrible

Review.Titre: I can't recommend this registrar as…
Review.Contenu: I can't recommend this registrar as reliable. I registered many domains for my clients. Complaints came in for several domains and they blocked the entire account despite the fact that there are over 700 domains without complaints. So, our clients have lost more than 700 (!) domains, on which there was not a single complaint, people cannot work. Clients lose tens of thousands of dollars, so there is no way to change dns, renew or transfer domains. We wrote a complaint to ICANN, we are preparing an application for filing with the court.

Review.Titre: blocked card at the time of bidding.
Review.Contenu: I placed a bid on an auction domain 4-5 days before it ended. no one was bidding, but before 5 minutes 2 people started bidding. I was outbidding them but certainly, they blocked my card and I lost the domain.

SAV is a cheap registrar. Other than that, they have the worst service in comparison to GoDaddy & NameCheap. They have regular issues with payment gateways & with Credit & Debit Cards. Even if a ticket is raised, issues are solved at their convenience without any intimation after the issue is solved. I have been having problem since the past week in renewing my domains, but what is the point when they have such pathetic service. They don't even have a proper customer service no in case of emergency also.

Review.Titre: Awful customer service, shady policies and no ability to cash out
Review.Contenu: You won't find anyone who cares about the brand image at this company. I was notified that my domain would expire in 30 days if I didn't take explicit action. Not one day later, they charged me for an auto-renewal (even though the previous email had stated that I needed to take action lest I lose my domain). I'm not upset about the money - just the awful customer service that completely dismisses any progressive conversation attempts. This company has some terrible policies, and I don't trust it one bit.

I am able to make payments at GoDaddy & NameCheap at the same time with the same card, but not at SAV. I spoke to my Credit Card Customer Service Agent & they confirmed that there was no issue with my Credit Card, since I was & am able to use the same card online.SAV is hopeless when it comes to solving any issue, coz they have a very bad technical team who cannot address issues, but blindly blame others & step away. I'm tired & sick of their service. All this while I have not received even 1 call from any Customer Service.

I transferred my domain 13 year old vivahmantra.com to them and  is missing, when contacted saying that I listed in marketplace for 0.99 dollar after renewing it for 8.99 dollars, its a premium domain which was listed for 1000 dollars on sedo and now when I decided to launch a matrimonial website it is missing. Like this they  taking control of premium domains. Beware of domain registrar SAV.com, do not register or transfer the domains to them, if you already have domains there immediately transfer out the domains. They are not domain registrar, they are domain brokers who will sell your domain in domain marketplace. I already contacted ICANN to cancel their accredation. Instead of restoring my domain they are threatening that they we will it take it seriously, Very soon your business will come to an end just wait.

Review.Titre: I have been having problems with 2…
Review.Contenu: I have been having problems with 2 factor verification.I have activated 2 Factor Verification to my SAV Account. But, when I try to Login, I receive the code after 60 Seconds only. So the Code has long expired by the time I receive it.  This has been happening since the past 4 days. When I try to find help or file a complaint, there is no option of raising a ticket without logging into my account.There is no Info in Help regarding this issue. It doesn't make sense that I can't raise a ticket without logging into my account, when Logging into my account is the problem itself.I had to search Google & found an email at TrustPilot to forward a complaint. But I receive an Auto reply with the following msg.(Thank you for reaching out to Sav Customer Support. To provider faster resolution to support inquires and improve our security, we are ONLY ACCEPTING NEW TICKETS VIA OUR HELP CENTER. To submit a ticket please visit their website and login to your Sav account.)So, I am back to square one. Isn't this senseless, when Logging into my account is the problem itself ?P Prasanna Kumar

After purchasing a domain the seller talked me into accepting it as a push at Sav.com instead of transferring it to a reputable company. What a mistake. I lost control of my domain. Sav support was slow to respond and when they did they did not acknowledge the problem. They blew it off. Now I am out of my money and my domain!EDIT: If I wasn't still pissed about what I lost due to this I'd find it funny that now Sav wants to try to help. Nevermind they initially ignored me when this was happening. Or that their first reaponse to this review was to instantly mark it as fake. Of course I had all the documentation to show TrustPilot it wasn't fake and to get this marked as verified instead. Then silence for months and now a reply they want to help. Too bad it's way too late the name is long gone. And I've learned my lesson not to deal with a fly by night company like Sav.

Review.Titre: Sav.com denied transsaction asked to raise dispute, later CTO confirmed refund, but later denied framing further narrratives
Review.Contenu: In the month of october sav.com has website latency, same can be verified by other user reviews on truspilot.com.Credit Card charged, but domains not booked.Merchant sav.com said over written correspondence, initiate c ahrgeback with bank as they can locate transaction.Later they said communication is valid through master card network and memebership banks.In the recent correspondence they have aagain written over the email that I do not have any active domains in my account + the same domin that they are trying to bill over my account, in the written correspondence they have said are available to be booked by anyone in the open market.Looks like either this is a website latency and operational issue within the cnflicting department or company is deliberately involved in credit card fraud.False allegation: The below comment by sav.com CTO nick that user deleted or transferred domain is false allegation. Their staff has accepted over the email that my account seems to have been hacked. The Nick is a man of poor integrity as after confirming return over email he is now framing answers to embezzle customers hard earned money. The company with a poor integrity. Why will I also delete domains that I purchased before these disputed transactions, and were not even under dispute.

Review.Titre: The carolinapremierbank.com domain has not been renewed.
Review.Contenu: Good afternoon.The carolinapremierbank.com domain has not been renewed.I paid for my domain renewal on July 27, 2023. The domain date was renewed on the rdn.name reseller panel. But I noticed that the date is not updated in whois.Wrote a ticket to rdn.name on August 1, 2023. In response, I received that the domain was blocked by the registrar and the registrar blocked the renewal / change of data for the domain.The domain has already been renewed and paid for by carolinapremierbank.com on 07/22/2024.I got a response from rdn.name“The registrar conducts domain checks to prevent fraud, phishing and copyright infringement.To activate the domain, you must provide a banking license, as the domain contains the word bank."This domain is not used as a bank, the word Bank in the name is just a domain name, nothing more. The domain uses the payroll application form for the aggregator. This is all spelled out in the disclaimer on each page of the site in the footer. Submit the Epp-Code for transfer, we can transfer the domain.But there is nothing illegal/fraudulent about the domain.I requested a transfer code but never received it.rdn.name canceled the invoice payment and received a response that codes for blocked domains are not issued.I asked to unlock the domain, to which I received the answer: "We cannot unlock the domain. Try filing a complaint with IANN."I contacted SAV Support. The answer was that the issue should be resolved through rdn.name.rdn.name was told that they contacted about unlocking the domain, but nothing was ever done.Please resolve the issue, there is nothing illegal on the domain.In response, I provide information from whois (download from who.is)carolinapremierbank.comwhois informationRegistrar InfoName SAV.COM, LLCWhois Server whois-service.virtualcloud.coReferral URL sav.comStatusclientTransfer Prohibited icann.org epp#clientTransferProhibited

As I said before names in your account at Sav.com have the very rare ability to just disappear from your account all of a sudden, and with no reason. I bought WUR.xyz in auction for $37 the other day and they transferred the name to me. Today I tried to find the name in my account because I had to change name-servers. Sadly the name is not there any longer. It has mysteriously disappeared. I guess it has traveled to a parallel universe or became a ghost and just left. Now I have to manually check all my names that are supposed to be in my account at Sav.com - one by one - to see what else is missing. I have to keep doing this on a regular basis in order to make sure I still own the names I have paid for. Hilarious! Try to imagine how safe I feel with Sav when I know that I keep names with them that I have bought for thousands of dollars. Has anyone experienced anything like that with other registrars?

UPDATE:  Within an hour of leaving this review, Sav requested more info through Trustpilot. They still didn't respond to my initial ticket until 8 hours later...their response "Looks like it's working"...IT'S NOT WORKING, so I responded....STILL NO FURTHER RESPONSE, NO RESPONSE TO MY ADDITIONAL TICKETS EITHER! This is the main domain for my server, replacing it would require an enormous amount of work, lost clients, lost time. THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE. I'll be calling my lawyer by end of the day if there's still no response on this mess!If negative stars was possible that's what I would give. Where to start, upon transfer in my main server domain, they froze it saying I didn't update whois.. there was NEVER ANY EMAIL requesting this.. when confronting this, they claimed that they was sent TWO DAYS BEFORE TRANSFER REQUEST?? Howv is that possible?? I demanded auth codes for all domains to transfer away .. Never given. Haven't had time to deal with it, few weeks later need to update hosts IP addresses as I'm moving to new server.... Won't update, attempt to transfer out, auth code provided in the account is invalid!! Submit several support tickets, no confirmation email that they are received... Send email to support email for sav... Ticket created but auto reply says they don't accept email tickets and it will be deleted. No phone number, no chat... Customer support non existent. Ridiculous! I'll be filing a complaint with ICANN... In the meantime, I'm screwed with my server transfer because DNS won't update.

Review.Titre: Seven failed attempts to transfer an io…
Review.Contenu: Seven failed attempts to transfer an io domain in from Uniregistry as payment form repeatedly issues "cannot process Gateway error" having used same account for prior transfers in and same account new registrations. Absolutely no response to my email advising of the issue to their support team.

Review.Titre: Unexpected Rebilling and Misleading Practices From Sav
Review.Contenu: Here's my experience with one of the most deceptive domain registrars I've encountered in my years-long career in domaining.In 2021, I placed backorders for domains set to drop that day, and those transactions were fulfilled without any hitches. However, fast-forwarding two years to 2023, some of these domains were dropped as per my decision not to renew them. To my surprise, these domains were re-back-ordered and paid for without my express consent.Upon raising this issue with SAV, their response was effectively shifting the blame onto me, suggesting that I should have manually deleted the backorders.I want to clarify that this wasn't a case of auto-renewal. This was a scenario where I deliberately allowed the domain to lapse, yet SAV chose to rebill me for the backorder.I made it clear to them that I was never informed about the need to manually delete backorders post-execution to prevent them from recurring indefinitely. Furthermore, I emphasized that I never granted them permission to use my payment method for any purpose beyond checkout transactions.Another warning sign I overlooked was the inability to independently remove payment options like PayPal or credit card. The requirement to reach out to their support for this simple action, coupled with their prolonged response time, should have given me pause.Having worked with numerous back-ordering services and registrars over the years, this is the first time I've faced a situation where I was charged for transactions that had been completed two years prior, and without my explicit consent.Stay away.
sav.com lost my domain name. They did not explain clearly. The domain name I bought for more than $60 sold at auction for as low as $500. So I got 1$. Looks ridiculous. Cheat

Review.Titre: Very bad support, comms & domain management
Review.Contenu: No violations have taken place on either domains as this was only ever forwarding to other websites and then this suddenly stopped without any communication. Unfortunately your response doesn’t solve the situation. Fortunately we have bought other domains for realassets.biz now at reassets.net and abinternational.biz now at abunitedglobal.com. We needed to change all marketing comms at great expense but we have been working with our current domain and web hosting company for over a decade so will continue to do so. Had we received information beforehand from Sav.com and not needed to write to you via support[@]sav.com without a response and then add a TrustPilot to actually get a response. The review will need to stand. As this will need to be the last time we buy any more domains from Sav.com. This will pose as a lesson learnt for your other customers or prevent them from using Sav.com at all. Happy to help...Update reply to an email to Sav:Hi, apparently there has been a violation in respect to spam for abinternational.biz when it has only ever been on a redirect and forwarded to another domain - so remove this ASAP so that serverHOLD can be removed. The same goes for realassets.biz with Sav and this is also on a serverHOLD as shown on ICANN. Remove this ASAP so that the domain can be moved to another registrar who is better equipped to service my business.--------------Original complaint:Perhaps this is the only way to actually get a response. For some reason two domains I have with Sav.com have been put on a ServerHold so this means I cannot transfer the domains out and this also means that the current domain forwarding is not working which I only found out about when clicking on the link. I agree that Sav is horrendous at customer support with no response from submitting a ticket. Please resolve above issue NOW look in your folder for support[at]sav.com about abinternational.biz ServerHold and the same within the submitted ticket.

Get your blank together! This is income you are messing with!No respect!

I do see that you paid for these domains back in Oct of last year but they are not in your account. I'm going to escalate this to our advanced support team to see what happens and make sure you get a full refund. My sincere apologies in advance. Best Regards, Nick R.CTO, Sav”In the month of October sav.com has website latency, the same can be verified by other user reviews on truspilot.com. Credit Card charged, but domains not booked. Merchant sav.com said over written correspondence, initiate chargeback with the bank as they can locate transactions.Later they said the transaction is valid through the mastercard network and membership banks.That means the company has double standards.In the recent correspondence they have again written over the email that I do not have any active domains in my account + the same domain that they are trying to bill over my account, in the written correspondence they have also said that domains are available to be booked by anyone in the open market.Company changed the storyline many times. In recent times, they were also selling domains that they claimed to be under my ownership on sedo.com. Later they again changed the story stating that it looks like my account was hacked. If for a moment I assume that I was owing the domain then how and when did they get a License from me to sell those domains on sedo.com?Their assumption: Sav.com is/are the smartest people on the internet, and the customer the most dumb.In the recent communication their CTO nick wrote: ()“Nick (Sav) March 30, 2022 8:24 AM (UTC-05:00)Hello. I read your Sav review and wanted to look into this personally. I do see that you paid for these domains back in Oct of last year but they are not in your account. I'm going to escalate this to our advanced support team to see what happens and make sure you get a full refund. My sincere apologies in advance. Best Regards, Nick R.CTO, Sav”Beyond the above correspondence with Nick, the corporation has stoppeed replying that means they won't refund.The corporation in which a CTO confirmed the refund, but later denies it. What kind of corporation is this who will trust w/o they showing any integrity?Whatever I have claimed above I am submitting proof for the same: All 6 PDF here:drive.google. com/drive/folders/1s1_sjnm4VLJkHDQEpARPp-l0FyUi2Q9xMerchant is in United Staes, and the Customer in India, which International body can Intervene? I think ICANN do not take domains disputes.

Review.Titre: Unethical Domain Expiry Practices by SAV Registrar
Review.Contenu: I have been a domain owner with SAV for several years. Recently, I experienced the loss of two of my domains, .io and .com, due to SAV's failure to send timely reminders about their expiry.The situation unfolded as follows:.io: SAV only sent one reminder before the domain's expiry and provided no further notifications. As a result, I unintentionally lost this domain, despite being willing to renew it promptly had I received adequate reminders..com: Similarly, SAV failed to send any reminders about the upcoming expiry of .com. Consequently, the domain expired and was subsequently auctioned off without giving me a fair opportunity to renew it.In contrast to other reputable registrars like Dynadot and Godaddy, who honor auction cancellation requests from current owners and allow domain renewal, SAV has refused to reinstate the domain in my account. This refusal, despite the registrar's clear lapse in providing essential expiry notifications, leads me to suspect that SAV may be purposefully promoting their auction platform by capitalizing on such situations.I am deeply disappointed and frustrated by this unethical practice by SAV, as it has resulted in the loss of my valuable domains and potentially puts other domain owners at risk of facing similar predicaments. I strongly believe that registrars should uphold their responsibility to ensure transparent and ethical domain management practices.I believe that ICANN's role in overseeing domain registration and management is critical in maintaining the integrity and fairness of the domain industry. By addressing this issue with SAV, ICANN can reinforce trust in the domain registration process and uphold the rights of domain owners.

DONT GO FOR IT BECAUSE OF LOW PRICE " You will regret the experience , and if you find any urgent issue to be resolved for example if you forget to renew a domain , THERE IS NO LIVE CHAT SUPPORT , AND THEY TAKES WEEKS TO REPLY TO YOUR MAIL!!

Review.Titre: Horrible, they lock your domain for 4 months!

Second, after the first month, they lock it for another 3 months because you bought a premium domain haha...This has to be the worst domain reseller from a customer and business point of view that I ever encountered...please don't fall for it.

Review.Titre: very bad customber support team  service
Review.Contenu: very bad service1. customber support team is not active: support team is very lazy type staff just time spending working. they will unwilling to response my complain.due to negligence of support team mr. mathew my 23 domain is mistakenly iniciated auction and support team is unable to cancel this error in timely manner.2 he has no enough knowlege to support custermer.3. he is not eager to help customber.4. its look like company has only one staff who has heavy work duty and not provide support in time and staff just working as a formality.5. my 23 domains is now transfered from my account to another account.then i lodged a complain with icann.org regarding registrar mishadling of customer services by sav.comall happening of this is responsible for sav.com

Premium Domain Purchase of ****.com for $280.00 on 24-09-2020. I tried to move my domain on 05-01-2021 because I want to launch my website. Sav.com is forcing me to wait untill 10-01-2021 for no apparent reason. Emailed support to request the release of my domain but they replied that I bought the domain 60 days ago. 24-09 is more then 60 days. This company will force, restrict and apply cheap tricks to continue there hold on your domain.Never register your DNS at a company that limits you in anyway because it will costs you valuable time and money if you need your domain for your business.Sav.com is a business that I cannot recommend because they costs me hundreds of euros because I was not able to shift gears in a professional matter!

I came to Sav to purchase a domain I was looking for. It was listed for $266. My business partner purchased it to reserve it for us, and it showed "In transfer" on his Sav dashboard. I had him cancel it so I could purchase it on the proper business debit card, and it said "In transfer" for a week on my dashboard. Then, the landing page price went up to $3200. I then received an email saying they no longer owned the domain, but saw that the price of the domain went up to $9999. This is a classic example of Domain running. Sav saw that there was interest in the domain and hiked up the price to maximize profits. They are offering me a refund but this is just clearly dirty business tactics. An embarrassing excuse of a "domain registrar". Worse than a car dealership.
Terrible customer service. Ignore all these fake five star reviews. Read the forum threads at NamePros instead for a true picture of how awful this company is.

Stole my domains for 96 Cents! I listed 2 domains for sale through Sav auctions, I thought maybe if I started the auction with 0.00 min. bid I could draw more bids, the auctions ended unsold, 2 Days After the auction ends I get email from Sav claiming my 1st domain sold for 96 Cents, then I get another email the following day claiming I had another sale for 96 Cents, these domains were worth Far more, and I was fine with the auctions ending unsold, but how do you all the sudden tell me my domains sold Days Later, after auction ends but for only 96 Cents. I know what you are doing, I read how you guys buy the domains and Resell them for far more based on value, of course I can not prove this, but I promise you if I find out you Resold my domains at any time, I will contact the authorities. If the domains Really did sale to a Real Buyer, then why can't I see Any contact information for the so called buyer?

Review.Titre: Poor development team and money cheater
Review.Contenu: There are always bugs out there when you want to manage your domain on Sav.com. You can't change your domain DNS or request a auth code to transfer out your domain to other registrar. The dev team seems so amateur!Money cheater facts: I placed a domain backorder on 2019 and Sav got the domain for me but I decided to let the domain expire a year later. They automatic backorder the same domain and charge me! Event I let  the exact same domain name expire! I then fired a support email for this but got no response ever since(7 days already). What a money cheater and helpless support!STAY AWAY form this!EDIT AFTER REPLY:Sav.com will never response to your email and get things resolved. They just reply here and say some good words but never solved things. For my case, they still not responsed to my refund request email and say some good words here just for public relationship. They are thieves. Stay away from them.
the site lags very stronglyit is not possible to buy anything error conditionorders from the basket are constantly disappearing

I had been in the business for 23 years , I never witness a bad support like this company for many reasons I do NOT recommend SAV :I was about to transfer my 200 + domains from other registrar (Godaddy in my case) but thankfully I started by only one to test their services after many negative reviews, unfortunately there were a typing error on the domain provided , but strangely their system accepted the "Authorization Code" to transfer me to their payment gateway !After I noticed the error I sent them a support ticket request to refund my money as according to their disclaimer statement for domains that didn't land to Sav are eligible for refund but I got no reply for 2 days now !my third complain is that they do not have a ticketing system or chat so there is no way to communicate with them except to sit by your main waiting for days with no REPLY !.their website does not support mobile versions under "my account" so I have to "Display as desktop version" every time I have to visit their website.

Review.Titre: They have no idea what they're doing!
SAV Auctions sucks, they fail to charge me now they want to ban me, No solution offered!
Review.Contenu: I won an auction for a domain at SAV, they claim the payment did not go through, (I will explain this later) But now I am being threatened by SAV with mails they do not answer, saying I will be blocked out of auctions for "not paying" for the domain I won. The payment was not processed they claim, which is not true because all my cards on file with SAV and PayPal are active, triple checked and NO CHARGE was made for this auction, and other SAV backorders went fine, how can they can explain this?It is obviously SAV´s fault, but they are taking it on me the customer, failing miserably to process a simple charge or offer a simple link to pay.EVEN WORST.SAV Support is really SLOW and answers after 48 hours with no solutions but with more excuses NOW SAYING they will Auction again the domain I won!!HOW CAN I PAY THEM?SAV DASHBOARD has No link or tab or any other way in their system for clients to Check the Status of an auction, nor to PAY for a won pending payment auction.NOTHING, they run on a pretty weak/lame dashboard to say the less and offer no solution but pass the blame on the client???I have 3 forms of payment added to my SAV’s account I have asked several times to be charged/invoiced or simply Give me a link to pay, the answer?SILENCE, Clearly they would rather stay quiet and offer NO solution and go auction the domain I won, back while blocking me out, in the process.My hands are tied!Note that I've been registering and backordering domains with SAV every week while this happened and ALL charges went just fine, the same day I won the auction they kept charging me normally for other services! How can they explain that?WITH THE AUCTIONS they have clearly lost heir North, affecting my interests with delays, threats and silly excuses, will they block me? At the same time they do not charge me, nor they offered a simple invoice or link to PAY for the auction I am running in circles and no solution so far. Will keep you posted guys.My opinion: "SAV, auctions" Not recommended!

Review.Titre: It looks like SAV stole our domain name! [They fixed the issue]
Review.Contenu: Update on the review: They fixed the issue and released the domain name back to us, it’s being pointed to our name-servers now, but only after we made the review and exposed them here on TrustPilot. They still haven't replied our messages and tickets.We will keep all domain names with them, for now, but we will be very reluctant to register any more domain names through SAV. If another similar problem comes up again, we'll might have to drop SAV and move our business to another registrar. Let's see..  it's in their hands, they will keep us if they start acting professionally. ———————————Original review (1 star): ———————————We paid the renewal of an expired domain name in time, within the Grace period for .COM TLDs, but SAV although they took our money and the renewal went through with global DNS and Whois records, they parked the domain name to their own name-servers without our authorization obviously, resulting to our client's website to be down. SAV is not even replying to our messages about it. It looks like they stole our domain name. So disappointed, we thought they were a good service. We have hundreds domain names registered with SAV, we will be moving them all to other registrars, if this is not solved ASAP.

They sent a cheque for $9.88 for the auction, they charged themselves $50, even though the bids didn't even reach that price!I can attach evidence!-------------------------After a week and a half of investigation, the money was returned, but my experience with the company has been negative.

Review.Titre: Trying to Change Name Servers for 2…
Review.Contenu: Trying to Change Name Servers for 2 domains. I've sent 2 emails to support in the last 4 days and zero response. I've tried updating them 3 times and it's not working. So far I've wasted 4 days on this which should only be a 5 minute job.When I enter the new name servers and hit update nothing happens. This kind of basic function should never be a problem.UPDATE: I guess to get a response you need to leave a bad review. Anyway got it sorted out. Thanks guys.

Dear Sav,I am struggling with the lack of external customer support. There needs to be a way of contacting the support without having to access the help support upon login - Problem is I have relocated overseas and changed my mobile hence can not receive the 2FA number. And now can not login in. Please guide a safe and secure option. Many thanks

Review.Titre: Sav takes responsibility to take money but at refund its a big fuss
Review.Contenu: I am facing the problem repeatedly with the sav auction system; it deducts money even if the proxy bid has outbid you whereas it should be deducting money on bids which are eligible for "winning category"my more than $700+ are stuck with bank as they have no idea whether sav.com refunded the money or not, most of the times i get money back into the account within a minute but if it's stuck it takes forever to find.

Review.Titre: Liked their price and eventually a good resolution…
Review.Contenu: I am amending my previous rating because the company did finally admit their mistake and correct it. They put the domain in my account as they said they would. I regret for their sakes that it takes threats from individuals to get their attention and response from sales support. Customer service should have been all over any problem that anyone has almost instantly. There are too many chat applications available to not have something. Even a chatbot would give better replies than dead air. I have worked in and run customer service departments for over 30 years so I do know it can be done.Liked their price. Ordered my domain name and then approved using PayPal. Went through fast and then PayPal sent me back to Sav.com for completion. That is when the problem started. Nothing but spinning wheel for 2 minutes and then page says that my account is set up but they will send me an email when everything done. I went to bed and this morning I have an email from them saying they had problem with PayPal (no way used that account for years) and domain name purchase could not be completed. I followed all the links including going to PayPal which did not show a problem. Back to Sav.com and now they say the domain name is no longer available.

Review.Titre: domain names are put up for sale when…
Review.Contenu: domain names are put up for sale when they expire. They are taken from your panel

My first time using live chat. Not satisfied that I have to remove my name from the listing and then re-add it if I want to change the price on my name. I asked other questions about turning my parking on and off. Not satisfied with the explanation via chat. 🙁

Review.Titre: The domains are cheap but the platform…
Review.Contenu: The domains are cheap but the platform is not very good and the automated messages are not correct. An example there is irrelevant information and messages particularly relating to the non-verification of the domain when this had already been done and the message deleted, so how is anyone supposed to verify. Plus the verification link doesn't seem to be connected to a bonafide WHOIS verification link. Just sloppy!

I have to admit it was my mistake not to read the terms and conditions carefully at first. I was testing the domain marketing and auction features, then I lost almost all of my domains as they were put on the action during the testing, and there is no way to take it back. The responses from Sav customer service was in time and helpful in the beginning, but they were not helpful in the auction case.

Review.Titre: Good price, but no basic bulk update option
Review.Contenu: Everything is good overall. The price is good. But there is no basic bulk update option if I want to change nameservers for multiple domains at once. This is very inconvenient.  I'm not a developer but I feel it's not a highly complex feature to implement since most registrars have it. Sorry if I'm wrong. Keep growing! :)(also would be good if we could add more than 2 default nameservers)

The website lacks a serious customer support feature, I sent an email two days ago regarding a failed purchase for which I was charged, I am still waiting for a reply.I wanted to transfer my domains to sav but then I stopped because of this very slow support.
Your site is buggy, There were few domains which I had to buy through other Registrar because your site says not available.Overall I think it was a new experience.
Error 504 Ray ID: 57c50b6e8a6f1772 • 2020-03-30 21:50:09 UTCGateway time-outIt's hard to tell whether my order went through or not - though I received a receipt email. dosnt look very trustworthy :/

Review.Titre: No bulk update tools, no way to sort domain list online, you need to download the list
Review.Contenu: No bulk update tools. You need to open a page for each domain to make some changes. You can't sort the list of domains by name or date of expiry. All these things will need to be done through customer support, which is not so helpful in many cases. I have 100+ domains, to change domain contact, auto renew status or nameservers, I have to go to each domain and update. Sorting would have been useful if i need to find, which domains are expiring soon and click renew. Now I have to download the list, sort in Excel and then go back to sav.com. API option is for developers, I am just a normal user who has domains.Update: Nick from Sav.com helped me get what I wanted to do with bulk of my names and I am very grateful to him for the support provided in quick time.

Review.Titre: The bidding system is not fair
Review.Contenu: The bidding system is not fair, the domains I bought on my own are also bidding, it is very unreasonable to take 10 days. the website is not very detailed and needs to be developed.

Review.Titre: Unable to purchase domains by PayPal…

Review.Titre: UPDATED: Problem Solved by CEO involvement, many thanks to him.
Review.Contenu: If I could give no stars I would. This has to be one of the worst transactions I have made on the internet. I hope someone finds this page on time and actually sees the real reviews between all the greenery. I bought a domain name got my private practice and tried to get it set up with my host. The host was having a horrible time trying to troubleshoot. I worked with an independent contractor who buys and sells domain names and he even said that what was happening to my account is wrong. That it shouldn't have taken days to take my domain name off the market (IT STILL WAS UP THERE) especially since my card was charged right away and under "my" ownership. I emailed once and when they replied with the same cookie-cutter response I lost it. I read all their agreements. The domain name I know is a loss, but this was ridiculous. ONLY a law enforcement number is provided... how does that even work. I guess let's test it out! No domain name is worth having to go through that nightmare.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------UPDATED!!! On Oct 22, The CEO Nick Roskam reached out personally to assist me with my difficult situation via email. He was able to solve the issue by lifting the lock on the domain to transfer out. Without his help, I wouldn't have had peace of mind. Thank you, Nick. VG

They are good with their pricing. Probably the cheapest option there but that do not justify their horrible customer care. I hope they fix it and I'll come back here again to update my review, if they do.Edit: They were able to fix my issue just after few hours of writing this review. So, I added one more start.

So far, so good. Absolutely no issues. I put down the domains I was interested in and for what cost I'd be willing to buy them and left it at that. They monitored everything after that. A couple days before the domain becomes available for purchase I receive notice, providing opportunities for changing mind or payments, and then when the sale completes I get a receipt for the purchase. It's great, they have provided domains for amazing prices.

Review.Titre: Great drop catching service but lacks tools
Review.Contenu: Great drop catching service.  Very basic user interface and domain management tools.  Would like to see bulk tools added for portfolio management as well as an option to download domain list.  Would also be great if sav was a member of the afternic fast transfer DLS.

Review.Titre: This domain company is very good and…
Review.Contenu: This domain company is very good and genuine because the price of dot com is not very low according to the market prices. We can register a domain very fast. In many cases, it is seen in many domain companies that it takes much time to be active after registration but here the domain becomes active very fast after registration or putting the name servers.  WHOIS PROTECTION SERVICE also free here. Many companies may charge less in the first year but take much more in the next year at the time of renewal of the registered domain, but in this case renewal price is very affordable. And the only problem is here is that there is no white-label service. I need white-level service really.
Very good but payout need to be more fast

There's no automated support for DNSSEC setup, and I had some issues setting up custom nameservers, but a quick email solved both problems within a couple of days.  And you really can't beat the price.
MY PROBLEM SOLVED BY SERVICE! EVERYTHING IS OK! My money returned to my card succesfully! But my advice is to make service answer faster to questions of clients!

UPDATE: I was very impressed that after receiving my review one of the company executives reached out to me and took the time to get to the bottom of the issues that we had been experiencing. He was attentive, thorough, and an excellent communicator, and the end result was that some platform code changes were even implemented to make sure these issues do not surface for other customers in the future. So while my original experience was terrible, the company went the extra mile to turn it around. Kudos. ORIGINAL REVIEW:I had the worst experience with this company. It took them a full week after purchasing my domain to gain access to the DNS. And then the domain expired without any notice whatsoever from the company that the expiration date was near. There's no phone support, and no weekend support. So nothing could be resolved quickly. Worst domain registrar ever.
Thanks for the great service! I'd like to manage my domains with other colleagues. I'm wondering if/when I can create such team in the service.
